Reviews.Title: “Travelers BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacktseng1377
Reviews.Content: The place is actually 3 star quality and more motel-operated There is no service with luggage and the breakfast is indeed lackluster What annoys me most is that I requested a higher floor a month ahead and they ended up giving me a room on the first floor! Save your money and go elsewhere! Even the Expedia unpublished 5 star hotel ended up cheaper and far better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, limited facilities”
Reviews.Author: Wayoutback99
Reviews.Content: As mentioned this hotel is in a great location. It's off the Gran Via by a few hundred metres but oh so quiet and clean. I've stayed in Madrid ca. 5 times and this is the best location. The hotel itself is relatively small which again is a plus. However it does lack facilities. Even though the website says it has a gym / fitness area this is an extremely small area in the roof, the windows are all fogged up. Can't do a decent work out. Breakfast is generous. The hotel decor is dated, from the late 80s in brown everything. I did have a massive room thanks to an upgrade. Only major down side was the late night door men have a bit of a pompous / judgemental attitude. Just because I'm not old and wrinkled and with a woman on my arm doesn't mean I can't stay at a hotel. This annoyed especially being there during Madrid Pride.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karina B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Opera towards the end of July 2012. I had arrived to Hotel Opera at around 8am and they settled me into my room right away which is unheard of in most hotels not only in Spain, but also in the States. The concierge was bilingual and extremely helpful. There is a restaurant and bar downstairs which is also convenient and has great prices. The location of this hotel is what makes it excellent. It is centrally located with short walks to Gran Via, Puerta del Sol, Royal Palace of Madrid, the metro and more. I had no complaints about my room; it was a good size, it was clean, had a comfortable bed and the a/c was cold. I had a very nice stay at the Hotel Opera and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster breakfast, otherwise a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Miguel A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in central Madrid, across the street from the Teatro Real, and a 10 minute walk from the Plaza Mayor, and near a major subway station. Would highly recommend one of the top floor rooms, our's had a huge terrace with a spectacular view over the city. It also had a jacuzzi which we just didn't have the time to use. The breakfast at the Hotel Opera leaves quite a bit to be desired, both in terms of quality and ambiance. We found starting the day here a bit depressing. Otherwise this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Breakfast, and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: RovingProfessor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Opera based on a review by Rick Steves. I was more than happy with the selection. The rooms were nice. The staff was an incredible help to us despite our language barrier. The location was within walking distance of everything (might be long to the park and museums for some). The airline lost our luggage for two days and the owners and staff at Opera were extremely helpful in us getting it back. Due to my lack of Spanish, they made several calls on our behalf. Would definitely stay there again in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “We Really Enjoyed Our Stay at the Hotel Opera”
Reviews.Author: chsb97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for a total of 6 days in July- 3 days at the beginning of our 2 week trip and 3 days at the end of our vacation. We were immediately made to feel comfortable here. The front desk welcomed us to a clean and modern room right in the middle of Madrid. Hotel Opera is a nice place to stay if you want to walk around Madrid or be the subway which was a block away. Bathrooms were modern, with good showers. Breakfast was tasty and plentiful, appealing to me with my vegetarian tastes and to my daughter with her more American breakfast preferences. They never got the coffee quite right but the rest of the buffet more than made up for it. For an extra delicious treat, walk up to the Mercado de Miguel. It is "tapas on demand," all day up there. When we came back to Madrid and The Hotel Opera at the end of the trip, we were welcomed back as old friends. Our new room was equally nice, the coffee still off and the breakfast still tasty and plentiful. I would recommend this hotel and for sure we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: gammo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at this hotel in May. It was close to Palazo Real and the Sabatini gardens and Plaza Mayor which were the only 3 sights I wanted to see again, having been to Madrid earlier some years ago. The reception staff were very courteous, recommending a fabulous place to eat dinner for which I was really grateful...Madrid has a lot of expensive disappointing restaurants but not Il Bodegon! Breakfast was good...I am amazed by the number of sweet croissants the spanish eat! The room and bathroom were both upto scratch though our beds were small by any standards. For the price, which was reasonable, the hotel passed in all respects .

Reviews.Title: “Good value; great location”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay with another couple. The hotel is clean and the rooms comfortable although they are quite small. Our bathroom was modern and clean with lots of giveaways. Breakfast was good with a reasonable selection of cereal, pastries, cheese etc and some cooked food. I thought the coffee was okay. The best thing is the location. It's a few minutes walk from the Puerto Del Sol and next door to Plaza Oriente. Gin lovers will appreciate choosing from the encyclopaedic collection available in the bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Just enjoyed my second (well, fourth) stay at Opera”
Reviews.Author: elizcu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel in June and July of 2011 and 2012 and while I agree with other reviewers that the American students can be a bit noisy and the breakfast coffee is pretty awful, in the 4 times I have stayed at Opera I received an incredibly warm welcome and quick attention to any of my needs. The food in the cafe is quite good, and was an invaluable convenience when I was traveling with my son. When he was too tired to go on, we went downstairs for a lovely meal and some people-watching. Transportation is no issue - the Opera metro stop, a taxi stand and 2 local buses are steps from the front door. And the Royal Palace, Descalzas Reales, Prado, Puerta del Sol, Thyssen Museum, Parque Retiro and shopping are all easy walks. The rooms are Spanish '4 star' and very clean. There is street noise, which is the trade off for such a great location in a busy capital

Reviews.Title: “Friendlier Staff would greatly improve this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anne G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a recent visit with a small tour group. It is in an excellent location, and the rooms are comfortable. However, the visit was plagued with glitches that may not have been the fault of the hotel staff, but that were not handled with any amount of grace or accommodation. The Internet was not functioning. The staff kept insisting that it was the fault of the guests, who "did not know how to connect." Really? All of them? That message was delivered by the young woman at the front desk with an attitude of impatience and irritation. Similarly, one of our tour group was placed in a room with broken air conditioning in 100 degree heat. Again the hotel denied responsibility, though it was eventually fixed. If you value the prime location of this rather expensive hotel, go for it. If you prefer service with a friendly and courteous smile, skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Anthony K
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be better located for a first visit to Madrid. Clean basic Spanish '4 star' hotel. Room clean. Staff friendly. Breakfast coffee poor! However check that there are no tour parties of braying North American students booked in when you are staying - they clutter the place up and make passgae to the breakfast room hard in the mornings - that is if they haven't trashed the breakfast room when midnight feasting the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable location”
Reviews.Author: DYK
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Spain trip and spent three nights here at Hotel Opera. Our room was a triple facing the opera house, so it was plenty spacious. The bathroom had a tub/shower as well as a stall shower and a double sink. the room was very clean and bright. We did have some street noise in spite of metal blinds, but it didn't keep us awake. We were in Madrid during the last game of the Euro cup so we saw lots of excitement in the plaza. The location is very good--20 minute walk to the Prado and 5 minutes to the Royal Palace. We liked the cafe because of its convenience and the staff was vey friendly and helpful. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: We took a trip for the wifes birthday to Madrid, as we had been to spanish region but never to the capital. Overall a very good hotel, very central, and easily accessible to the Metro. Staff pleasant and helpful. Rooms slightly above average and reasonable. breakfast was good and will set you up for the day, Getting there As it is a 2 min walk to hotel, we took the metro, taxi would run you about 30 euros or more, hotel has a shuttle for 13 eur per person, and do drop offs to airport, did not check if they arrange collections. I would recommend the shuttle or taxi if you have a lot of luggage, we had one piece of carry on each and a bag, so we took the metro. The cost is 4.50 (1.50 plus 3Eur supplement). On arrival to airport, follow the signs within the airport, its about a 5-7 min walk from our arrival point taking a right and following signs. Take the number 8 line to Nuevos Ministerios, transfer to grey line one stop to Cuatros Caminos, and then transfer to red line for opera, overall took about 50 minutes from airport to hotel. On arrival at airport walk up exit with the opera house facing you, it is on the right hand corner, you cannot miss it. The location is very central, but we still purchased a travel 10 ticket in the airport for trips to Bernabeu and the Park, and more than person can use it, just put ticket in the machine, walk through, then hand it back and the next person can use it, this is perfectly normal and allowed. the airport trips will take up 4 anyway, don't forget you will need an airport supplement ticket on way back, which you can buy at departure point or at the airport. The hotel Check in was a breeze and we checked in just after 11am and got a room, so we could start touring straightaway. Hotel is 3-4 minutes to Plaza Oriente, Palacio Real, 10 minutes or less to Plaza Major and Mercado de san Miguel (which you have to try). Free Wifi but you will need a code for each device, I took one but could only use on iPad and not on smartphone, they will give you a second no problem. Hotel also has 2 communal computers for use should you need them, email check in online etc... Room was pleasant if not overly large, plenty of closet space for a couple, bathroom was large in comparison to room, and pleasant, showers powerful. Only downside was some slight noise from street at night time, but nothing that kept us awake, light sleepers might want ear buds, but it was low level. Beds were singles pushed together and made separately which was fine for us considering the wife does a World In Action when sleeping in hot countries. Aircon worked fine. Flatscreen TV but never used it, too much nightlife! Toiletries in bathroom. Staff were very pleasant, and always wanted to help. Breakfast was selection of fruits, ham, salamis, cheese, cereals, fresh juices, coffee and eggs scramlbed and boiled with bacon sausage or mushroom, and plenty of cakes, croissant etc..Very pleasantly surprised at selection, only downside was if a lot of people arrive at the same time, plates glasses etc.. can be scarce, no big deal for us, as it only lasted for about 15 minutes and was then resolved, I think I heard a comment of staff arriving late or absent for morning shift. Enjoyable trip, very central and would stay here again. Tips - You have to try the Mercado de san Miguel, for a bite to eat, beside the Plaza Major. You can get negotiate on paintings in the Plaza Mayor on Sundays, we managed to get a decent painting and knocked 20% off the price, could have gotten more I think but, it was great value for the price purchased, we used Aer Lingus and not the nazis in Ryanair, so was easily transported back home. Tried Sobitin, nice to do as oldest restaurant in the world, but quality of food can be easily beaten elsewhere, and cheaper too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , good service !”
Reviews.Author: Haifa-LHP
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Opera House and the metro is just around the corner. Great and clean rooms . Good breakfast and gently staff !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel Opera, Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Sheela H
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4-day stay in Madrid where I stayed at the Hotel Opera. The hotel was very comfortable, clean, lovely bathroom and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is suited to all types of travelers and located right in the heart of city, a 2 minute walk from the Metro 'Opera'. It takes approximately 45 minutes to get to and from the airport with 2 changes on the metro. Breakfast has a wide selection of food to suit all so can't fault it. In addition there a several cafes nearby should you wish to venture out. I shall definitely be returning to Madrid and will definitely stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ysgs
Reviews.Content: Great location, central and easy walk to Plaza Mayor, Puerto de Sol, Gran Via, Royal Palace. Tourist bus stop nearby. Metro round the corner. Found the hotel quiet, we were in a room on 9th floor, it wasnt the smallest of rooms but the sloping wall/ceiling did cause my hubby a few problems. breakfast was adequate but it wasnt very well laid out and in a small room, said it seated 50 but more that a dozen people in there in morning made it very cramped and staff very slow to clear tables. The cafe attached to the hotel was very good, excellent service from everyone who worked there. would go back

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best in Madrid, oh yes!”
Reviews.Author: delfina46
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the center of Madrid! staff very friendly,very enthusiastic, service room with a high quality. The room itself was quite nice and large.

Reviews.Title: “Second and Third Time are Charmed”
Reviews.Author: piccoloa8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Opera with my teenaged son in March of 2011 and was sufficiently taken by the hotel, and in particular its location, to ask my travel agent to book my mother, sister, and I there for a trip just this week. We book-ended 10 days in Spain with 2 nights at Hotel Opera on arrival and 1 night on departure. The things I had liked about the Hotel in 2011 remained: great location, sound night sleep, clean (see smoking note below) and well-appointed in a basic "IKEA" manner, helpful staff, and broad breakfast buffet. What really pleased me is that the restaurant has changed its menu (and perhaps its chef?) and was very nice indeed. Not high end, mind you, but for tapas and light sandwiches, it really filled the bill. One of my traveling partners this trip has issues with mobility (knees), diet (no seafood), sensitivity to fragrance, and a large build. I confess that we found the single room too small for her to negotiate easily and even the double room a bit difficult. This was a matter of both space around the beds and the layout of the bathroom. Our second room had a walk-in shower which was much easier than the tub-shower of the previous room, but the door to the bathroom of the second was much narrower than that of the first room. You should know that there seems to be wide difference in the size and shape of the double and single rooms n different parts of the Hotel -- some designs are efficient and well-thought-out, others are not so. Elevators and ramps made getting around the Hotel easy for her, but the chairs in the Breakfast Buffet were uncomfortably narrow for her. The buffet breakfast is, in my opinion, very nice. I enjoy the local flavour of the offerings: jamon, cheeses, fruit, pastry, coffee, and beautiful, fresh OJ. My traveling companions -- who prefer North American breakfast -- had more difficulty with the selections as they found the eggs, bacon, sausage to be undercooked for their taste. As a last cautionary word, despite being a non-smoking hotel, one of our rooms had clearly been smoked in. We chose to not say something until check-out, and the one of us who stayed in that room still got a good night's sleep. The front desk staff was very gracious when we mentioned it to them, and I certainly had the sense that had we needed to make a change, then that would have been accommodated. The staff at the front desk was exceptional. When some of our travel documents failed to arrive at the Hotel from the travel agent, the staff was very helpful with getting these to our room right upon arrival, and they were very good at helping connect us by phone with our travel agents both in Spain and in North America. When one of the drivers needed to make a change in departure time, the staff even helped the driver track us down in their restaurant. Hats off to the staff! There was a Rick Steves' tour staying at Hotel Opera at the same time we were, so that has to say something positive as well!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location !”
Reviews.Author: itsjustbigjim
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, clean, huge bathrooms. Front desk staff very attentive. Great central location, good, full breakfast buffet. Late night street noise can be bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, gentle and kind stuff it's not easy to find!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthy G
Reviews.Content: A very warm welcome to the heart of Spain!!! Marvelous well located hotel, very close to the tourist center.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to locate.”
Reviews.Author: hamhugfizdog
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this small hotel is that it is in the centre of the city and it is easy to explore the city by foot. Front desk staff were helpful and spoke good English. The rooms were spotless but small. We travelled as a family of 6 and asked for 2 rooms. We were given a camp bed in each room and as a result there was not room to swing a cat.Neither room had a kettle nor cups and teabags. Breakfasts were rather disorganized. There were never enough seats/tables; cutlery and glasses trickled through as they were washed; orange juice disappeared as soon as it appeared. The food itself was mediocre. Our Spanish friends told us to breakfast at a cafe where the food would be tastier and more varied. We ate in the restaurant downstairs on Saturday night which was fun and entertaining. We all enjoyed the "opera" even the teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly well located”
Reviews.Author: anibs
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in the Opera Hotel in March 2012. The location of the Hotel is great. It is next to "Palacio Real" and at a walking distance to "Puerta del Sol", "Gran Via", "Plaza de Espana" and other tourist attractions. The Metro station "Opera" is just across the street and there is an elevator which is very convenient for elderly or disabled travelers. Not every station in Madrid has elevator and sometimes there are a lot of stairs to get to the trains. The first room we received was facing a bus stop and the noise was disturbing. After complaining we changed with no problem to a higher floor and far from the bus stop. We were unlucky enough to get a room next to a very noisy guest and we could not sleep that night. I must say that the staff in the hotel handled the problem very efficiently and the next 5 nights were perfect. The room is small and basic, the bed is comfortable and the bathroom is renovated, spacious and well equipped. We asked for a shower instead of a bath and we were happy to get a room with our request. The breakfast was good enough. Most of all I must say that the staff at the reception were very nice and very helpful. I would definitely return to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Visit to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: CandGEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our first visit to Madrid which we thoroughly enjoyed. This was partly due to where we stayed i.e. Hotel Opera.Fantastic location, very close to many major tourist sights e.g. Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor, Calle Mayor, Metro etc. The hotel was very comfortable with good facilities. We enjoyed the breakfasts - great choice of foods, something for everyone. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful.I would stay here again and would recomend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TimzTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our visit to this property! It's close to popular tourist spots, shopping, restaurants and the Metro, but comfortably off the main drag of Gran Via. The only downside was its proximity to a busy bus stop which created some outside noise at times, but this was more than offset by the clean, well-appointed rooms, attentive staff who understood different languages and free WIFI. Rates were reasonable for the area so you should definitely give this property a try if you're visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for touring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Huskies92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera twice during our recent family trip to Spain. We stayed 3 nights for our Madrid stop, and then one night before we flew home after we finished touring Granada and Seville. The room has a very modern décor, it’s a standard European size room, i.e. small, but everything worked properly. We were first given a non smoking room with a strong cigarette smell. We asked for a different room and the front desk happily put us in a different room. The breakfast wasn’t as good as some other hotels that we stayed at for our trip to Spain (especially the coffee), but it was included as part of the stay so not much to complain about. The location of the hotel can’t be beat, it’s right in the middle of the all the tourist actions but half a block away so it wasn’t noisy at night. If we go to Madrid again, we’ll definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Madrid - OUTSTANDING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have written on Trip Adviser. May I strongly recommend the Hotel Opera. Daniel Carus von der Ehe Head of Reception and third family member to manage in the hotel could not have been a more welcoming host. I left my running shoes in the room on my day of departure. Housekeeping located them and Daniel sent them on to follow me home, free of charge. Needless to say, we had a great stay, in a great city, in a great hotel. Jon Livingstone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: layla m
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - perfect location. Room are spottless, staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is excellent (you don't need a lunch after having it !).

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelDude
Reviews.Content: This place is really awesome, the rooms are a little bit smaller (my room is about seven feet across in total), but it is clean the bed is comfortable and everything works. The Internet is free, the food downstairs is fantastic, and included in my full board price, and overall experience is fantastic. The staff are knowledgeable and friendly and very flexible. I had to cancel my shuttle to the airport, and this wasn't a problem my money was refunded on the spot with a smile. I will be returning here on my next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Yvettetravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nites. The location is great. Our room was modern and clean. The beds were comfortable and the amenities sufficient. No such thing as a washcloth so get used to using a hand towel as a wash cloth. Easy to use safe, good TV, mini bar with reasonable priced items. The front desk is helpful. We found the breakfast buffet to be plentiful. Free computers in the business center and free wifi in your room. Being in Madrid, you do not spend much time in your room so as long as you are not looking for 5 star luxury this is a great place to stay. We took the metro from the airport and it was 2.50 euro per person. You change trains twice but since they are color coded it is remarkably easy. The Opera exit is not even a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good stay!”
Reviews.Author: liz m
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel: the location, the interior of the room (which had a very cool, modern design with clean and new fixtures), the breakfast, and the staff (who were very accommodating). Also the price was reasonable, at least during the time we were there (January). I definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Kw09127
Reviews.Content: Delighted with this hotel, perfect location for traveling through the city, many options for included breakfast, good beds, close enough to the action,but quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_Macka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights between xmas and new year with my girlfriend to celabrate our engagement. Had a room on the top floor with a jacuuzi on the balcony which was great. Room was spotless and plenty big enough for two Hotel reception was always manned and happy to help Location is the key to this hotel. you can see the royal palace from the hotelo and there are numberous bars and restraunts all around the hotel The bar attached to the hotel is always busy and reasonably priced I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Madrid as i found it to be great value for money considering its location and quality. Couldn't have asked for better

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all around hotel”
Reviews.Author: PBH68_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and then returned a week and a half later for another night. The hotel is is greatly situated for a tourist. The rooms are modern and clean. The hotel breakfast bar the best we experienced in Spain of the 9 hotels we stayed in. The staff was friendly and helpful. And - the price for the room was very reasonable compared to everywhere else we stayed in Spain. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location ... but ....”
Reviews.Author: Karlito81
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 nights at the Hotel Opera in Madrid over the holiday season. The hotel is nicely decorated, clean and situated in an excellent location in central Madrid, a few minutes walk from main shopping streets and major attractions. I must however point out 2 clear negatives: 1. Internet service, although included in the room price, was terrible: slow, often without any signal and the daily code per each device is very annoying. 2. Breakfast was not up to standard of a 4-star city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stayed 2009, lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth G
Reviews.Content: this review is rather late, but when I stayed in March 2009 I found the hotel opera a great place to stay on my first trip to Madrid. location near the palace and opera house meant nice choice of restaurants on the doorstep and easy transport connections. unlike many hotels we viewed, we liked the modern style of Hotel Opera, which was classic and unpretentious. good provision of services (wifi, toiletries, etc) and friendly staff. Would stay again and recommend. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, well located, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sheenman
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel, quite centrally located with helpful, friendly (English speaking) staff. Good for overnight or short stays, rooms too small for prolonged stay. Comfortable beds with good firm mattress. First class buffet breakfast with great range to choose from. Everywhere clean and well kept, though our shower spray would keep drooping despite attempts to fix it. Free use of internet access in the TV room. The only downsides were - sound insulation poor, no tea-maker in our room, and the restaurant associated with the hotel (Cafe Opera) where we had a disappointing lunch. However there is a wide choice of restaurants around the area. From the hotel we walked to the Prado, the Thyssen Gallery, the Parque Retiro etc., and the Royal Palace is just a street away. If you don't care to use the Metro to the airport (it involves two changes) there is a useful shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of the major sights and metro station.”
Reviews.Author: jomar70
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for exploring the old centre of Madrid,within easy walking distance of the Prado and Thyssen collections. The area is blessed with numerous restaurants and bars with a wide range of prices. Hotel staff very friendly and helpfull, comfortable room with a well equipt modern bathroom, very good breakfast with an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all around!”
Reviews.Author: sfelkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera in mid-November and were very pleased with the hotel. Free wi-fi, in-room safe, breakfast buffet and a very comfortable room. The staff was helpful and spoke pretty good English. The buffet was extensive: ham, eggs, pastries, fresh fruit, breads and fresh squeezed orange juice. The location was ideal -- just a couple minute walk to Puerta del Sol and the Royal Palace. We definitely recommend Hotel Opera!

Reviews.Title: “Great stays”
Reviews.Author: pbh68
Reviews.Content: During a recent trip to Spain we stayed twice at Hotel Opera. Everything about the hotel was great. Its location is superb, the staff friendly and professional, the rooms luxurious for the price and the breakfast the best we had in Spain. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: gregc1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days in early summer. While the rooms are small by US standards, compared to other hotels we stayed at in Madrid and Rome, they are comparable in size to other hotels in the area. Windows had roll-down shutters which did a great job of shutting out noise and light. Bathroom came well appointed with more than your standard amenities (comb, razor, soaps, etc) and had a frosted glass appearance which made the bed room area seem a little larger and lighter as a result. Great location just a block from the Opera subway, and a couple of blocks from the Royal Palace, which is worth a visit. There is a good Argentine steak house just two blocks south (going towards Calle Del Arenal), and a good, authentic paella restaurant one block south, that are both worth the visit. It takes three stops to get to the hotel from the airport, and in some transfer stations you might not find escalators or elevators, so if you are traveling with something more than just carry-on, a taxi ($75 or so) might save you the trouble of hauling heavy luggage up and down stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to fault”
Reviews.Author: CYKL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the beginning of September. We had 2 rooms. It was the 3rd Spanish city in this trip (Barcelona, Valencia, Madrid). The hotel was easy to get to. The subway was close. There was a hotel restaurant with outdoor seating, and a separate smaller one for breakfast. Breakfast was adequate. I particularly like the hotel staff here, as this was a trip where I had to a lot of interaction with reception staff, asking for hot water at wee hours in the morning as well as late at night, to make milk for my child. The staff at Opera were the most obliging and I was never made to feel that I was intruding upon them amidst their usual duties of checking-in guests. We checked out of the hotel at 6am and our breakfast was already packed for us to bring along. Room was a little old but everything works and it was clean, so I am not concerned. Walking distance to the palace, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WhiskyVance
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel on reccomendation of a friend and are happy we did. The room was very modern and clean though not overly large. Bathroom was marble with frosted glass walls. Location is great we were able to walk to the palace as well as many of the squares. Food options abound close by but the Cafe' in the hotel was only fair. The best value that really sold us was the full and I do mean full breakfast included with the room. A real time and money saver. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base from which to discover Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Shelagh C
Reviews.Content: The staff are all extremely friendly and very helpful. Out standard room was clean and well thought out; the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom elegant but practical – a large walk-in shower in place of a bath may not be to everybody’s taste but we loved it. One minor fault is that the ceiling where the extractor is needs some anti-mould spray! We were on the 5th floor and it was very quiet indeed. A lovely buffet breakfast sets one up for the day. Another very minor moan – the TV package gave the French and Germans something fairly decent to watch at bedtime but all the English speakers had was BBC World, CNBC and Bloomberg!! We can highly recommend Hotel Opera.

Reviews.Title: “A Full Breakfast Included- Unheard Of In Much Of Spain!”
Reviews.Author: RalphT785
Reviews.Content: This is an excellently run hotel and all of the staff are well trained and find time to give help if you ask for it. I had several occasions to go to the desk and ask for help (phone calls for lost credit card, Zarzuela information, help with ipod etc). Each time I encountered a different staff member and each time I received excellent support. The room facilities are great and the generous breakfast (at no extra charge) is very much appreciated. The location couldn't be better and the hotel is very easy to find (from Atocha train station take Metro to Sol, change lines and get off at Opera which is one stop from Sol, look around the square and find the Burger King and walk past the Burger King toward the Opera house and around the next corner the hotel is on your right.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice staff..Love the Café/Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: seni3
Reviews.Content: Hotel Opera is situated in a great location, it is very close to the Opera, the Royal Palace and close to two different metro lines, Opera and Sol. There are plenty of things to see and do just in this area, the pharmacy isnt far and neither is the laundromat. My room was clean and modern with everything I needed. I was on the first floor so it was a little loud at night while people were out partying or getting ready to go to work in the morning, but it wasnt horrible. Breakfast was good in the morning and the hotel offers a variety of options, which is always a good thing. I had come to enjoy the banana yogurt and when it wasnt there one morning, I asked one of the ladies if they had any in the back and she came out promptly with my banana yogurt. She really went the extra mile for me and I really apprecaited it. We also ate at the Cafe once and the food was delicious. I was also allowed to sit, people watch and journal after I was done eating which was really nice especially since the weather was beautiful. It was easy to take the Opera line to get to the airport shuttle and the shuttle was an easy and relaxing drive to the airport. I will def stay here again if I am blessed enough to visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Opera is in the perfect location, a short walk to everywhere in Madrid. The breakfast is delicious. I recommend trying the cafe au latte in Cafe Opera, the pour the steamed milk right in front of you. It is delicious. If you get a shuttle to the airport with your room booking make sure to secure your departure time to the airport at least 24 hours in advance at the front desk. Staff is very friendly and speak English and other languages. It comes highly recommended by all the locals. Great Place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big City Respite”
Reviews.Author: piccoloa8
Reviews.Content: With Madrid as a last stop on a Spanish whirlwind trip, it was delightful to step into the uncluttered yet fashionable simplicity of the Hotel Opera. The staff was very helpful and easy going, the room clean and well-equipped (although not as quiet room-to-room as it might have been), and the location beautifully central. We found it very easy to put down our bags and within a matter of 30 minutes by foot be at the Prado with energy for the museum to spare. On subsequent days we found ourselves just steps from the Palace Royal, the main pedestrian area near Puerta del Sol, the Plaza Mayor, the subway, and even the funky Egyptian Temple (a GREAT sunset venue!). We found the beds to be comfortable and the breakfast to be excellent, although the breakfast selection seemed to diminish with later seatings. This hotel was the only time we were in Spain that we turned on the TV, and that only to watch the coverage of the Formula 1 GP qualifying and race that Saturday and Sunday morning, but we did find that English channels or even English subtitles were not an option. This may be typical for Spain, but I mention it here in case you know or suspect it to be otherwise. The major drawback to the hotel may have more to do with evening meal times in Spain than the hotel itself, but even being there on that major pedestrian area, it was impossible to get even basic tapas before 8:30 in the evening except at the hotel -- not even a small market or easy deli close at hand. On the first night we hunted around everything that looked plausible and were turned away from a number of establishments because the kitchen was still closed: starving at 8:45 we opted for the only restaurant open and it was sorely lacking. The second night we walked to Plaza Mayor and were able to eat at 8:00 and could have picked up something at the nearby "market" earlier if need be. The last night, we just lumped into the Hotel restaurant because the weather had turned and we had been to Segovia and we had a morning flight -- but honestly, the dinner menu looked very creative, but the quality of the food was marginal. Scheduling an airport shuttle through the hotel worked, but they had us in a bit of a panic because we couldn't make the request until 24-hours before the call-time of the shuttle, and it was less than 12 hours before the pick-up time before the Hotel could confirm we could get the shuttle at all, and in the end the shuttle was more than 30 minutes late arriving. You might be best off making your own plans for airport transfers. Oh, and lastly, the glass walled bathrooms -- while beautiful -- meant that a light in the bathroom at night meant that the whole room became lit. So all and all, the sleeping and room part of the hotel was very good, the breakfast was great, but be ready to have to go very-off-site for an evening meal (and be ready for it to be a very late meal at that!)

Reviews.Title: “Very good, contemporary hotel, great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Anna D
Reviews.Content: We loved our contemporary room. There was lots of space to hang/put clothes and Hotel Opera provided us with all the amenities needed. The only thing missing was an iron. The bathroom was clean and modern. The only complaint my husband had was that the toilet seat didn’t want to stay up. We loved the breakfast. They had lots of things to choose between. We also tried the upstairs restaurant. The cheese pizza was awesome. The Wi-Fi was free, but didn’t work well in the room or the breakfast room. The staff was very friendly (we dealt with most of them) and the location was great. It was close to all the major spots. The noise could be kind of loud which would be true for any hotel in the downtown area. Ask for a higher floor and bring ear plugs. I would definitely recommend Hotel Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Internet”
Reviews.Author: vipsi75
Reviews.Content: Every day was necessary to force a password to use the wifi ... is not easier to provide a password expires in days of the end of the stay?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jfehrenb
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel; it became a home away from home. Rooms were modern and well appointed. MSNBC and BBB on the TV. A/C worked like a charm. Beds were comfortable (two pushed together in Euro style) in our room. Excellent free buffet breakfast. Cafe was a great place to work with an iPad or PC; friendly staff and very good tapas and cappucino. Across the street from the Opera House and Opera metro stop. One block from Royal Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My Goodness- the best”
Reviews.Author: jointpain
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with excellant staff...I loved everything about it. The location was superb, the breakfast was outstanding and the rooms were cleaan and inviting. I can not wait to go back! Patricia H.

Reviews.Title: “An extremely good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: A very clean and modern hotel, courteous and helpful staff. Very good breakfast, good internet access. Slight levels of outside noise but what does one expect in the middle of Madrid, a good bottle of wine sorts this out though...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel....Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaBound1
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff at reception made us feel welcome from the 1st second we arrived. The hotel was wonderfully decorated, clean as could be and the included breakfast was both convenient and delicious. Following our departure we left a cell phone in the taxi the hotel arranged for us---and it was recovered. We can't thank them enough for being who they are - great people!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: viali17
Reviews.Content: This a superb hotel, great location, very clean, staff was helpful and spoke English. Room was quiet did not have any problems sleeping, great Continental Breakfast. Couple minutes walk from the Regal Palace, very close also to Plaza Mayor. Overall Hotel Opera offers great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel. Excellent standard in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MerseysideMargo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for our city break in Madrid. The staff at reception were incredibly helpful - all of them at any time of the day or evening. My daughter speaks fluent Spanish but that was essential in any way. The staff spoke perfect English and had such a wide collection of suggestions as to how we could spend our time. Will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised....”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBeachbum_01
Reviews.Content: I will let you decide if you think Hotel Opera provides excellent customer service. In December 2010, I requested two rooms for three nights each for a stay in June 2011. I received an email in Decmeber 2010 from Hotel Opera confirming my request; along with the agreed upon rates for the two rooms over the three day stay. When I arrived at the Hotel Opera in June 2011....here is what happened to me: 1. Upon arrival..... with the hotel's email confirming my reservation for two rooms at the Hotel Opera....I was told I was being moved to a different hotel around the block. 2. Upon checking in at this "substitute hotel"....I was told they had only one room for the requested three nights and that for the second room.....I could have one room for one night....then I would have to move to a different room for the remaining two nights. 3. Upon checking out of the one room for one night.....and moving to the other room....I reviewed my invoice for the one night stay and discovered I was charged 14 Euros more than what the original Hotel Opera's confirmation email listed. I then had to take time out from my short vacation in Madrid to notify the Hotel Opera and request a refund. So based on the above......I will never again stay at the Hotel Opera...or it's "sister hotel". But you can decide for yourself whether to stay at the Hotel Opera...or another hotel that they may choose for you!

Reviews.Title: “Best property we visited in Europe”
Reviews.Author: dedlund
Reviews.Content: Central location, helpful & friendly staff, comfortable room, great cafe, free internet access -- Hotel Opera exceeded all the requirements for a great vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A well run, value-for-money hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: CardiganJones
Reviews.Content: About 100 yards from Opera Metro station, walking distance to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Palace Real and a 15 minute walk to the entertainment hub, La Latina. A quiet location considering where it is. In short, very well located. Staff are helpful, rooms are clean and not too small. I'd class them as reasonably stylish rather than chic. There is Wi-Fi in the rooms and a gym that is too small to swing a cat. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved everything about my stay at the Hotel Opera.”
Reviews.Author: Amadea111
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Opera was perfect for my needs, i.e., near the Prado Museum, the Puerta del Sol, La Gtan Via, Recoletos, Cibeles, La Puerta de Alcala. There are good outdoor cafes on nearby Calle Arenal. The renovated Plaza de Isabel II is beautiful and an attractive venue to sit and observe people. The taxi stops and bus stops are located in this square. The breakfast in the hotel was excellent and varied: tortilla espanola every day (one of my favorite Spanish foods), lunch meats, cereals, juices, fresh fruits yogurt, pastries, croissants, fresh coffee. The hotel staff is friendly and very professional. The reception desk was helpful when I asked fofr directions. I brought my own laptop with me, and with a user name and password provided by the hotel, was able to use it in my own bedroom. The women who cleaned my room were very friendly and attentive to my personal needs. The hotel's cafeteria and outdoor cafe offer delicious, fresh food at reasonable prices. In sum, Hotel Opera surpassed my expectations in every aspect. I will definitely return to Hotel Opera.

Reviews.Title: “please avoid because of service”
Reviews.Author: rajatvohra
Reviews.Content: ok.. so we are on a 15 day spain tour..... this is our 5th hotel.... to give it some credit... the hotel is not that bad.... but the service is just patttheetic.... people are straight up rude.. we were at breakfast and sharp at 11 some guy announced that the breakfast was closed and made us leave.... if you speak english please avoid.... the cleaning lady comes at 9... then at 10... then at 11.... and they just barge in your room.... room was dirty... the gym that they keep boasting about is very very puny..... rest of the 4 hotels have been greatt... this one....just a bad taste.......internet sucks.... people suck.... room highly ok.... please avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Music everywhere”
Reviews.Author: debocat945
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The location is filled with music as it is near a music school and there are guitar, violin, and bass players on the street. It is charming. The hotel is equally as pleasant. The front desk personel is wonderful, rooms are roomy and clean. This is a contempory hotel with very good breakfast plus the hotel is wi-fi. Everyone that worked there seemed so friendly and helpful and as this was the end of our trip that was especially welcomed as we were exhausted. The locaton was wonderful as it was a short walk to everywhere and easy access to buses and cabs. We would definitely stay there and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: professoradams
Reviews.Content: I don't know what hotel the person stayed in with all the negatives. We stayed in this hotel about 6 years ago before the remodel. We had a very pleasant stay then and again this time. The rooms are on the small size, but we had adequate closet space and room in the bathroom. We stayed 2 nights one week and returned the following week for another night. The breakfast room does not have windows and I preferred the old one, but there were no bad orders when we stayed and the food was very nice. We had a major problem with getting our rental car that had been reserved many weeks in advance from the States, but because of the Easter holiday the office was closed where we were to pick up our car. Andres Agundez one of the desk attendants spent over 1 and one half hours on the phone finding us a car so we could continur our trip to Barcelona that day. Without his help we would have been stranded or forced to take the train, which was not practicle for us and about 3 times as much money as the car. My husband and I highly recomend this hotel and will definately go back when we visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “good loction”
Reviews.Author: btonboz
Reviews.Content: good effecient staff, well located with a good breakfast. room small but clean and ok, but only a wardrobe, no drawers. free internet, and well stocked bathroom, but toilet up against the wall, and shower head so low, only caters for small people. The main downside, is the walls are so thin i could sit in bed and hear the people taking in both rooms either side

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: dirk12
Reviews.Content: we spent 12 nights in Hotel Opera in Madrid. paid on beforehand so we couldn't escape anymore. such a bad experience never again we hope. rooms are very unpractical, small and dusty. no hooks, no drawers, no proper place to put away your stuff. only dwarfs and children can use the toilet properly because in the place they give you to relax you get stuck all the time and you hurt yourself trying to clean the other end of your body. forget about oxygen because you will be obliged to sleep with the windows closed against the noise and the smell but the heat - without the airco - in this small room was unbearable. so we left Madrid with sinusitis, laryngitis and bronchitis caused by the sometimes also smelly airco. the hotel is extremely noisy. all kinds of noises both from the inside as from the outside. forget about sleeping. 3 different large recycling containers in front of the hotel are emptied on 3 different moments every 2 nights again ! and all rooms are situated at that same street side. walls apparantly are very thin because every night again we could enjoy the really disgusting throat and nose noises from the other hotel patients in rooms near to ours. lucky we were we didn't smell the farts we heard. cooking and sewer smell are always around in the corridors like in some obscure 3rd world hotel in some disadvantaged neighbourhood. the breakfast room is small and dark and without any windows to the outside. only some lucky moments we could have our breakfast without the traffic and sewer smells. and when you like your tea with lukewarm water this is the place to be ! don't count on the pictures of this hotel. they are misleading and deceptive. this hotel is overrated and overpriced in all respects. they probably had to bribe some big shot to get the stars they claim. it is a real rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and underrated --perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bionutcase
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent - near but not on the main pedestrian zones, Plaza Mayor and Sol, Opera, and royal palace. I would definitely recommend against staying in a hotel in a pedestrian zone/plaza in Madrid if you have any intention of sleeping. Madrid is awake all night long and Spaniards love to converse and do so with great gusto. The rooms were clean, modern, and relatively spacious. The staff was by far the most friendly and helpful of any staff I've encountered in Europe. The free breakfast was excellent. Overall among the top few of dozens of hotels we've stayed in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: shelleyayres
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely, minimal but very comfortable with everything you need. The bathroom is a good size and very clean. The location is perfect, easy to find and surrounded my beautiful architecture, gardens and cafes. I arrived in Madrid after a 14 hour journey from Qatar. The hotel was easy to find from Opera Metro station... you can see it as you enter street level. The staff were welcoming and friendly. I needed to print a few pages for an interview the next day and they did that for me free of charge. Breakfast was great and very tasty indeed! I will need to go back to Madrid in June and August and will definitely be staying at Hotel Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: gezball
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in sunny Madrid. We had a triple room with an extra bed to sleep 4 and excellent value for money compared to other hotels. Service was great from reception to waiting staff , all attentive and helpful. The location is perfect with easy walking to sights and metro on the door step to take you further afield. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.The only downside and it was minor for us, was the noise from outside. It is a city and its busy so you should expect some noise no matter where you stay. The opera area compared to other areas is probably the quietest. Overall a great 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jetrun4327
Reviews.Content: had a lovely stay at opera for 2 nights....top floor balcony and relaxed in jacuzzi everynight, SUPER quiet room, we got in around 10am, didnt expect room to be ready, the concierge called housekeeping and asked them to clean the room for us, then invited us for breakfast while we waited, PERFECT service food was great just what we needed after a long flight. really classy hotel, we felt like royalty, they were so nice and accomodating, we had a really great time!

Reviews.Title: “Opera- service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Bexlee666
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 4 day stay at Hotel Opera in Madrid. We were happy enough with the Hotel it was in a good location within walking distance of all the main areas. We decided to splash out and booked a double room with jacuzzi and balcony. The room itself was small but nice and clean...however we couldn't help but feel it was fairly pricey for what it was! Also the walls are paper thin so if you're an earlybird it may not be for you. The breakfast was nice -a selection of pastries, fruit, bacon and sausage toast etc. Our only complaint was that the breakfast room was small and so got overcrowded. The staff were extremely helpful and spoke english very well. Beware of the cafe inside though as they are strictly Spanish speakers and didn't have a clue what we were talking about -it was extremely frustrating!!! My boyfriend and I saw many sights while in Madrid. If you're going the bus tour is a must, as is a visit to the Bernabau (I don't even like soccer and I still found it amazing!) Also if you find you have a day to spare a trip to Camp de Casso is extremely worthwhile. It's a large park with an amazing zoo, aquarium and theme park and you get to see the animals close up. In conclusion if I were to visit Madrid again I would probably stay somewhere in Grande Via (as all the shops and pubs are there) Hotel Opera is a nice clean hotel with great staff. In a quieter part of town I would say it would suit the 40+ age group. Overall an enjoyable stay with no major complaints apart from the fact that it's a tad pricey.

Reviews.Title: “CANNOT beat the location, good breakfast, wifi iffy...”
Reviews.Author: Goog_and_Pooh
Reviews.Content: Did a father/son trip arrived/left from 16th-19th of November, 2010. Actually this hotel was my second choice (dad let me do planning--Pooh was unable to go so Dad subbed :) as I first attempted Hotel Meninas (one street over) and when the website said it didn't have the availability I need it recommended its 'sister' property. Took trains from Barajas and it was really easy--took about 35-45 minutes--even if the walk at the airport and the second station (Nuevo Ministerios) were fairly lengthy. The same cannot be said from the 2 Train Opera stop: pic out the window accompanying review shows distance to plaza where stop it--maybe, MAYBE 200 yds all on sidewalk. One ancillary note to address common complaint: our room was right above the noise and construction, but the hotel cant really do anything about that: the entire subway plaza and what appeared to be a taxi turnaround on the side of the Opera House were both under construction--I'd be surprised if there were not finished or nearly so. I don't buy the manager's responses about 'were downtown so it's loud' as it was the construction--in the absence of that even on the second floor it was generally quiet--maybe some advisory on the website regarding the construction progress would help alleviate complaints and apologies. On the way out, took a joint use van to airport that was around 10-12Euro a person but only took about 20-25 minutes underway and not nearly as much trying to 'figure out' where to go next--didn't see that on website on way in, just posted on front desk for way out. As you can see, we stayed in a two twin bed room and it was located on the second floor--I usually took stairs and dad the elevator. Lights in halls are cool as they're motion sensor and come on as needed. No problem checking in even with a slight language barrier--my Spanish was almost on par with the staff English but the reservation number and the AMEX did most of the heavy work. Rooms are pretty small but like most other trips we don't spend much time there save sleeping. If you're a TV junkie, hope you speak Spanish--only Bloomberg Business was in English. If you're looking to catch-up via the internet, at least where we were on second floor wifi in room was weak at best but in lobby much better--they have two computers as well for general use. Lots more 'suits' at this hotel so probably caters as much to business travelers as slackers like me (and Pooh and Dad). Beds and pillows extremely comfy and nice safe in room for passport/computer/extra $$ and whatnot...not much going on on the desk but good place just to empty pockets. Bathroom was actually big compared to size of room and shower never failed for hot water; a little moldy in the crevices but nothing I couldn't handle. Breakfast was excellent a cross-between American and Continental European (what I assumed was more Spanish breakfasty) item, but all fresh (except fruit salad) and a lot of it--no fridge in room to squirrel away stuff for later though [given late dinners the Kid needs grub]. I can't vouch for the adjoining restaurant though it seemed fairly busy: with Gran Via and Calle de Arenal both at your doorstep, you'll have plenty of eating/drinking options if you time them right. There appeared to be a bar up on the mid-level of the first floor but I never once saw any movement in there (even as late as 8-9pm) save people waltzing back and forth to computers. Was a bit rainy when there but mass transit (buy the Tourist Travel pass at airport; http://www.crtm.es/servlet/CambiarIdioma?xh_TIPO=8) and lots of indoor stuff makes passing time easy. Already mentioned Metro stop as being really close (and right across the street from McDonalds--free Wifi BTW but they're not open for breakfast at all...open about 11 I think). The Theater/Opera, Grand Palace, Asian/Oriental Gardens (beware of solicitations for massages), Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol (another train stop too), Gran Via and other notables are all less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Trains and busses made getting to Prado, Naval Museum, Thyssen-Bornemisza, and Atocha Station all no brainers. You could really walk to Prado in about 1/2 hr if you wanted. Within walking distance, we also made our way to Plaza de Espana for the Segway tour of another part of city. Definitely do not need a car and in summer wonder if you'd even need transit pass--though you'd be wise to bring your Rough Guides phrase book...lot fewer English speakers here than in Amsterdam (previous review).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deanio79
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay in the Opera Hotel in Madrid. Lovely hotel and very stylish interior. The room was very pleasant although we did get a lot of noise from the hustle and bustle outside. The breakfast was ok but not a great selection for vegetarians. Overall I would recommend this hotel. Great location for exploring the city and staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jonathanmckenzie1950
Reviews.Content: Located in 'old Madrid' near to Opera House and Royal Palace, with easy walk to Prado and other galleries via the pedestrianised streets. The reception staff were really helpful and the room although small was clean and ideal for a short break. One criticism was that satellite TV had 37 Spanish language channels and only BBC world news and USA business news with no access to Discovery etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Lijger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera for 3 nights. Lovely hotel and lovely staff! Always ready to help you (also in English)! The location of the hotel is superb... Just two steps away from the royal palace. The rooms are clean, spacious and warm. We loved the open shower and the bathroom. Also the breakfast is wonderful. A lot of choice... Meat, eggs, pastries, fruit... Also, really convenient are the hours of breakfast, this until 11 am. Only "bad" things are the noise at night (from the street) and the poor wifi-connection. But excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good value”
Reviews.Author: sleugers
Reviews.Content: I think the Hotel Opera is best noted for its convenient location and its value. Service was quite good. Breakfast hours are long, which is great for accommodating different types of travelers and their schedules. I didn't appreciate that the "double room" was two separate beds pushed together, and I didn't love the open shower (it got a bit chilly). But the room was absolutely adequate and worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: potbelliedpig
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was recomended in the Frommer's guide. No hospitality, Very rude and unwelcoming staff. Average restaurants with unhelpful staff. Breakfast was nice, rooms are small but well equipped. Bathroom was spacious and clean. We would not return here due to rude service

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location - nothing was too much trouble.”
Reviews.Author: Scoobydoo069
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay at the Hotel Opera, where the rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff very obliging and the location superb. Whilst there we split our time between a triple room and a superior room on the roof-top complete with jacuzzi, sun loungers, patio set and views of the Royal Palace. The hotel arranged a gorgeous birthday cake for my partner, with bottle of bubbly and hand made gluten free cakes for me, I asked in advance for an iron and ironing board in the room and they were there for our arrival. The iron appeared to fuse the electrics in the room one morning and a quick call to reception saw an engineer knocking on our room in minutes. He promptly sorted the problem for us and apologised. They wished my partner Happy Birthday on the day of his birthday and were keen to ensure that our stay was memorable. Breakfast was buffet style from 7.30 - 11.00 - offered plenty of choice each morning, my only criticism would be that the breakfast room had no windows which was a pity. However the Cafe Opera seemed popular with residents and non-residents alike, and offered extensive opening hours. The location is superb - just metres from the Opera Metro station, which provides a cheap and convenient method of transport across the city. We ventured out to Toledo for the day via train - having first watched the numerous turtles in Atocha station. The trains were clean, extremely quiet and efficient - but be prepared for an airport style check in for your train - when baggage and tickets are scanned prior to boarding. We felt safe regardless of the time of day or night as the city abounds with police at all hours and seemingly at all locations. Be prepared - English is not widely spoken in Madrid - take your phrasebook if you wish to be understood!

Reviews.Title: “Dismayed to be bumped”
Reviews.Author: Petitbois
Reviews.Content: Although we had made reservations online six weeks in advance, when we arrived we were told that "Madrid had collapsed," and they were sending us to another hotel for the first two days of our four day stay. We were promptly ushered into a taxi. We arrived at an old, run-down, inferior hotel, Principe Pio, and were charged the same as the 4 star Hotel Opera ($129 Euros/night). When we returned to complain to Hotel Opera, the truth came out. Apparently there had been an influx of athletes--instead of the 24 they were expecting, they had a group of over 30, so we got bumped. (I suspect they were able to charge the additional athletes more due to the increase in demand. They also had a Rick Steves tour there, so they certainly weren't going to bump any of them.) When we did move into the hotel for the last two nights, we were given a room on the top floor, overlooking the street and nearby plaza where construction was going on until the very early hours of the morning, so it was almost impossible to sleep the first night. Other people on our floor had rooms on the opposite side and were not bothered by noise. The only good thing about the hotel was the breakfast buffet. Because we complained vigorously about being bumped, we were given one night without charge, but since we were charged twice what Hotel Principe Pio normally charges, it was a wash. If I had wanted to stay at a two star hotel to save money, I would have. We had chosen Hotel Opera for its quality and were very disappointed at the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: harrisment
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay. The hotel is in a very good location near to the palace and metro station. The room was adequate and very clean but I have to agree with previous reviewers that it was quite noisy. the first night I was awoken by loud singing in the early hours and a little later by someone having a shower in another room. The glass bathroom walls and doors may look good but do not provide adequate soundproofing. There was construction work going on outside as they are pedestrianising the square outside which should look great when it is finished but our room was on the 7th floor on the side so we were not disturbed by this. The buffet breakfast was good with lots of choice and overall I felt the hotel offered good value.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT- CLOSE TO EVERYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: deskios
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife from Athens to Madrid. I t was our first time to Madrid. The hotel was excellent. The manager said us that it is a fumily run bussiness so they care about everything and the can fullfill all your demands. It is very close to the royal palace and of course you can go on foot to any tourist place you like. Do not forget to get on the madrid vision bus (both routes) and walk ,walk walk in the town. It is an easy and cheap way to see the town. Ask info to the reception and they will be more than grateful to help you and give you everything you need. Unpredictable servive and smile. Thank you Opera hotel. You were great. Keep doing great job.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of the city centre”
Reviews.Author: loek111
Reviews.Content: Hotel Opera is a great hotel to kick of your Madrid city trip. The hotel is located on a one minute walk from the royal palice and a one minute walk from the metro! The staff is very friendly, the hotel is clean, the interiour of the rooms is very modern, the bathroom is lovely. Only remark; the breakfast room is a bit dark, less motivating for your new day. But overall a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: sharkybar
Reviews.Content: I stayed n this hotel for six nights with my wife and although it is situated in a great location I was slightly disappointed. On arrival we discovered the square in which the hotel is located was undergoing major re-development, I know this is not the fault of the hotel but it was a pain to have construction work outside your window from dawn to dusk had I been aware of this I would not have booked this hotel. I found the room small for the rate especially as we were not booking during a peek period, we also discovered the television remote missing which we reported however it took five days to replace. During busy periods the breakfast room cannot cope with the demand, there are not enough tables and when they do become free there are not enough staff to clear them, the same happens with replenishing food and crockery. Having said all that the staff were very helpful , would I stay again?, only if my other choices were unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking up”
Reviews.Author: KarloMarlo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly located in the center of Madrid. 2 min walking distance to the Palacio Real, 5 min to Puerta del Sol. The Wi-Fi is available in the room. But that is pretty much all I can say about this hotel in a positive way. We've required the quite room on the upper floor upon arrival with the windows facing the court yard. And we actually got such room. BUT!!! The room feels and looks like a small cage (weirdly remodeled part of the attic) squeezed right between the two extremely noisy facilities - elevator and Gym. What an interesting interpretation of the 'quiet' room by the hotel management! Of course we asked if there is anything else available and being offered either non-smoking room on the first floor or a room on the 4th floor in a smoking area (both facing the busy street). We choose a horribly smelled room on the 4th floor in a smoking area to be as much far from the street noise as possible. But it didn't help actually. The whole area in front of the Opera House (where hotel is located) is a construction zone now. The workers start drilling the asphalt at 6 a.m. every single day. But if you think you can sleep quietly until that time you are wrong. Between 2 a.m and 4 a.m. the garbage tracks starting their noisy business picking up the huge garbage cans placed right in front of the hotel. I understand that ongoing construction work and garbage tracks are out of the control of the hotel management but putting all things together from our point of view the 3 nights stay in this hotel become a pure nightmare. Oh, and by the way - the glass wall that separates room and bathroom is another weird thing. If you’ll turn on the light in the bathroom while visiting it at night you definitely wake up your partner. That's all, folks.

Reviews.Title: “hotel opera was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: petesplaces65
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i just returned from a week in madrid ,where we stayed at the HOTEL OPERA.The service was excellent with a great buffet breakfast to start your day.it is located right next to the royal opera,less then 5 minutes to the royal palace,10 minutes to plaza de mayor,and 20 minutes to the museums.the rooms are quite and spacious,it available i recommend upgrading to the the rooms with balcony and jacuzzi for an added experience.if i ever get back to that place of the world i would stay there again without a doubt.so do yourself a favor if you go to madrid and stay there .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: travel_nut24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Opera in August. We were originally booked at another hotel and then came across this hotel. It had good reviews, the price was excellent and it seemed to be well located, so we booked it. This ended up being a really good choice. The hotel has recently been upgraded and all of the rooms are very modern and nicely decorated. The rooms are a decent size with very large bathrooms. One thing to note is that this is not a fully non-smoking hotel, and although we booked non -smoking rooms, one of the rooms smelled like an ash tray, I suspect they just removed the ash tray and called it "non-smoking". We probably should have asked to change rooms, but as we were travelling as a family, they had given us rooms next door to each other which was really convenient. Aside from this, the rooms were spotless with really comfy beds. On arrival, we received a complimentary glass of sangria (it was delicious!) Our stay also included breakfast each morning, and this was a highlight of our stay. The breakfast was amazing!!! They served the best bacon I have ever had!! Tons of choices - fruit, cereal, eggs, bacon, pastries, wine etc. It was fantastic. The hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to lots of restaurants and shops, and other sites. There is also a metro station across the street. It was really easy to get around and the hotel staff was very helpful when we asked for directions. As well, the hotel manager was great. Very friendly and accommodating - he helped us with taxis, advised us on the most economical way to get to the airport, and helped us with online check in for our flights. He was great. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The only problem was the noise at night, which did disrupt our sleep. Although we weren't on a noisy street, they did garbage collection in the middle of the night and the sound really carried, even if your windows were closed. Aside from this, everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay in the same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: hm57
Reviews.Content: The welcome was excellent when we checked in, after that whenever we passed reception the staff normally had their head in paperwork and we were rarely greeted. There seemed to be no sound insulation at all. The room next to us put their TV on and we did not need to have any imagination regarding the programme they were watching. The noise from the street was horrendous, as if it was just outside our window, I could also hear the metro trains rumble below when I put my head on my pillow and we were on the 7th floor! Breakfast was good and the location is fabulous. Corridor lights are automatic but don't stay on long enough to put your card in the slot for your room lights when you are at the end of the corridor. Water pressure for the shower was very poor. I paid for this along with the travel so I cannot comment on value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: atillery
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the last leg of my trip with a friend. The rooms are very nice, very clean. It's a very secure building with an elevator and 24-hour staff. The breakfast was fabulous and a great way to start the morning. The only downside was that the windows are very small and there are no rooms with small balconies. It was still a very nice hotel and bathroom. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Magus_10
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days with the children visiting Madrid. The location is great, in the vicinity of the Royal Palace and within minutes walk to Prado or Puerta del Sol. Staff speaks good English (unlike many visited places in Spain), is very warm and helpful. The rooms are large, nicely decorated and very pleasant. The restaurant is nice and relaxing, with good service. Definitely great choice to stay when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: japrilbakke
Reviews.Content: We booked this last min, just days before we arrived in Madrid. The staff memeber insisted that we stay in a "romantic" room on the ninth floor w/ all the good views and so forth, we asked how much extra, and it was 0$, so we took it had a great view, a huge room and all for 89 EUR! there is a good restaurant, bar, and cafe on site, excellent wifi in the rooms, we had a king size bed, central air, and a mini bar, and the location was brilliant, a 2 min walk to the royal palace, a 4 min walk to puerta del sol, and a 15 min walk to the prado, it was a great experience that i would love to replicate if ever vacationing back in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo..bravo...Hotel Opera!!!”
Reviews.Author: MontrealDuke
Reviews.Content: This review wont be long because I cant find anything unpleasent to say about this gem of a hotel in Madrid..well situated(near all major attractions and metro system).The breakfast buffet was always well garnished,the rooms always clean and frosty...much needed when the temp. goes up to 40 c. outside.The staff was very helpfull in french,english and spanish of course.The hotel has access ramps for wheel chairs and strolers.So in other words....perfect...It`s always nice to find a great hotel when you visit a city for the first time and the Opera was all you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: drphonic
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I have to agree with all the comments about how accomodating and pleasant the desk staff, particularly the head of reception, were. It really helps travelers feel comfortable in a foreign, sometimes intimidating city when they're dealing with a friendly, helpful staff. The layout of the lobby is very simple & "user-friendly," but simultaneously, elegant. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean, they don't gouge you at the mini-bar (in which you can also fit your own items, unlike the States, and the location is great for late night restaurants and bars, as well as shopping. What else can I say? Thanks Hotel Opera!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great room!”
Reviews.Author: United_Chick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June, and we loved it! The location could not be more perfect. The Palacio Real is a two minute walk away (we could actually see it from our window!). There are some great restaurants nearby (100 Montaditos is a ridiculously cheap lunch but there are some nicer cafes/restaurants across from the Palacio). Shopping is also a short walk away. All the major must-dos are within walking distance -- the Palacio Real, St. Gines Church, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, and the Gran Via. The Prado is a bit of a walk but very manageable. Of course, if walking is not your thing, the metro is across the street (1 Euro per ride). The front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. We arrived very early, so our room wasn't ready but they worked very hard to keep us comfortable in the lobby and rush the room. The room itself was large by European standards. It was nicely decorated and clean.
