We got a triple room, which consisted of two twin beds and a sofa bed (it wasn't a pull out -- it was a comfortable mattress on a sofa frame and the same size as the twin beds). The bathroom was huge and had double sinks and two showers. Plus, the room had three large windows with a nice view of the plaza. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and would recommend the hotel to anybody. The value was great and the location couldn't be beat. However, the nearby Hotel Meninas (which is Opera's sister hotel, I believe) is comparable in price but has even nicer rooms, so I would recommend you check that out too.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a Madrid city break”
Reviews.Author: gloucesterblue
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place for visiting the main sights of Madrid. It is ideally located within walking distance of most of the major attractions, e.g. 2 minutes from the Royal Palace, 5 minutes from Plaza Mayor, and if you don't enjoy walking the Madrid metro is cheap, clean and efficient. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the front desk staff were very friendly and knowlegeable. Our room was on the top floor and not one with a balcony, but was adequately furnished and comfortable. Breakfast was a buffet with a wide variety to choose from. We also tried the hotel's "Una Cena Cantada", (Singing dinner)featuring singing waiters - Madrid's opera house is right across the street. The entertainment was good, the food adequate, the waitress unsmiling and the pricing excessive - don't try unless you really enjoy opera. But it didn't spoil an otherwise very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “You want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: nmf1
Reviews.Content: When you arrive exhausted from travel, the people at the desk are VERY accomodating and all of a sudden you feel refueled. Very conveniently located, clean, and homey.

Reviews.Title: “OPERA PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: JerryRussell
Reviews.Content: Small Boutique Modern Hotel, which is ticked all the boxes from a location, price and quality point of view. You are right in the centre of Madrid opposite the Opera House and beside the Royal Palace. Reception was well staffed by polite and helpful professionals. The bedroom reserved was a double and was modern and was set up as a twin bedded room with beds placed beside each other. The standard of bedding and towelling was high. There was no bath but a large walk in power shower. All washbag ammenities were provided including shaving foam,razor,comb,soap,shampoo,bath gel,sowing kit,shoe shiner,tooth brush and toothpaste. A good standard hairdryer was also provided in the bathroom beside the mirror. Breakfast was served in a compact room with no windows but the standard of food was very good. Beautiful cut fruits,cheeses,cold meats, pastries, hot bacon,scrambled eggs and you could even have a glass of champagne which was also on the buffet. We did not eat in the hotel outside of breakfast. I would recommend this hotel it was good value for money, we stayed three nights and it was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality on a great location”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_traveller_8
Reviews.Content: We would certainly recommend this hotel for a city trip to Madrid! The price/quality is very good! It is especially the location which makes this hotel worth a stay. You can walk to a lot of sightseeing spot, or take the metro (which is very easy in madrid). Staff is very friendly, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. As our room was just above the reception/entree we were afraid we would be bothered by street noise, however this was not the case. Breakfast is OK, but served in a dark, small room. The only issue we encountered here was with the shuttle taxi we reserved to get back to the airport: this was delayed by an hour which was really enerving. However, hotel staff was helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: tilleyma
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Madrid with my girlfriend in May 2010 and stayed at Hotel Opera. The hotel is centrally located and within easy reach of all the sights. Upon arrival the staff were kind enough to upgrade our room and were really friendly and helpful throughout our stay. In Madrid English isn´t as prevelant as in other parts of Spain, and the hotel staff happily made reservations at restaurants for us and helped us wherever they could. The room was clean, airy and well serviced throughout the stay. On our last day the Icelandic volcano was playing up once more and our flights at once point look threatened, one call to the front desk and they extended our checkout time to 2pm without cost to let us determine whether we were able to travel. To top it all off the breakfast buffett was plentiful and just what was needed before heading out into the windy streets of Madrid, All in all a great little hotel, would recommend to anyone looking to visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful service, location, and value!”
Reviews.Author: rrmatlanta
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. You get exceptional service in a great location for a great price. Newly renovated rooms are stylish and comfortable. The included breakfast is delicious. The location is great with easy access to the metro to take you anywhere you want to go. I have stayed here many times and would not consider staying anywhere else. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Tio-man
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the opera for a short city-break. Location couldn't be better : Quiet street in a nice neighbourhood (royal palace, operahouse, ...), metrostation around the corner, 5 mins walkingdistance from Plaza Mayor, Puerta del sol, La Latina (restaurants!) ... The hotel is a clean and modern building with comfortable rooms, especially the bathroom is very nice. Breakfast is basic but good. This hotel offers great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: nat9000
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent Valentines weekend in Madrid. We were staying in Hotel Opera. Beautiful hotel, excellent location, helpful staff, clean room and bathroom... What else can you wish for?? Cafes and restaurants are few meters away, everything is close by, hop on hop off bus around the conner. We had a great time and definitely will come come there! Everybody who is planning trip to Madrid, Hotel Opera just perfect for exploring city!!!

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: vanoula
Reviews.Content: great hotel,friendly staff,quite good breakfast and very comfortable beds!the location is great ,you can walk almost everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Carolann C
Reviews.Content: Visited the 23 - 26 Oct, got a taxi to the hotel which set us back 34 euro, on entering the hotel, staff member behind the desk was not what I'd call welcoming, spoke very little, didnt give any tips / recommendations. we'd booked a jacuzzi terrace room on the top floor - on entering room, our first instinct was that it was tiny - there were meant to be 3 of us but 1 of the gals couldnt make it at the last minute and if she had of come with us, i honestly dont know where she was meant to sleep! room was small, terrace quite nice, bathroom really small (i squashed my fingers between the door and the sink on the sunday), jacuzzi quite nice. Breakfast was not good - we only went once. Can be a bit noisey, and we were on the 8th floor. The hallways are really worn. Location was brill for us - we much preferred our end of town than anywhere else! the palace is simply breathtaking, some great cafes nearby, you can walk to plaza mayor in about 7 mins, if i was going back, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value for modern, immaculate hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaulegirl
Reviews.Content: Location was great for sidewalk cafes; staff were helpful & spoke English; service when needed was quick & efficient (help with TV & room service). Desk clerk helped us get taxi & reminded me that 35 Euro with luggage should be max for trip to airport. [only time a taxi driver tried to stiff us & we took may taxis in our 3 weeks in Spain & Portugal]

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for opera visitors to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: peterbergstedt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a find, especially for those who want to visit the Madrid opera (Teatro real), Situated on a quiet street opposite the opera house it has about 70 rooms, all with fine bathrooms, minibar, AC, TV, free internet and safe. Beds are wide and excellent. Moderate prices, we booked through hotels.de and got rooms for under 90 euros including breakfast. The only disadvantage we coukld find were the high telephone cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value”
Reviews.Author: airpower4
Reviews.Content: We spent our last three vacation nights at Hotel Opera. We stayed two nights in a queen room. It was very clean, spacious and comfortable. Unfortunately the only windows were the skylights since we got the last available room...top floor. For our last night we splurged and stayed in a terrace room. This room has a terrace with an awesome view of the Opera and the Royal Palace. Just off the terrace is an awesome jacuzzi and spacious bathroom. The room itself is spacious with a comfortable bed and a well stocked mini-fridge. The service was good. They usually only had one person working the desk so it caused a small line to back-up at certain times. They were able to make dinner reservations and other good recommendations for us and provided us with an iron/ironing board within 10 minutes of our request. Overall, I was very happy with the decision to stay at Hotel Opera...great location and good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: JAV919
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was jackhammering as the street in front of the hotel was being torn up. So we waited while a room on the 5th floor was made ready. (The jackhammering ended shortly after our arrival and did not resume because it was the San Isidro holiday coming up.) Our room faced a small plaza where motorcyles park, and also the stage door of the Teatro Real where crowds sometimes gathered, so there was some street noise but not too bad once the jackhammering ended. Do ask for an upper floor. Plaza de Oriente is a block away. Taberna del Alabardero only half a block. A pedestrian street, Calle de Arenal, leads right to Puerta del Sol. During our visit there were many street entertainers on C. Arenal, but that might have been because of the San Isidro holiday. Our room was small, really small, with neither chair nor table. Very modern, with LED lamps and stylish bathroom fixtures. Perhaps to a fault, since the sleek bathroom sink lacked an overflow drain (not a problem for us, but...). The breakfast buffet was great, in every way comparable to what we got at the Paradors on the rest of the trip, including unlimited coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice. I rate it better than the Paradors because the baked goods were better. There is a small sitting room near the breakfast room and in there were two PCs with fast Internet connections for guest use. The staff were friendly and helpful, and most had good English.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: jsmill1943
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the Hotel OPera earlier this month. We chose it for its location - it seemed quite close to central Madrid, but in a quieter area. Unfortunately there are quite a lot of road works in the area at present, including in the street right outside the hotel; but this did not prove other than a minor problem; we would certainly not be put off from going back there tomorrow if we had the chance!. And we found that we both liked the area itself and that it was convenient - by a longish but manageable walk, or else metro - for all the galleries etc we wanted to see. The hotel itself was very clean and well maintained, the rooms were a bit on the small side but were modernised and very uplifting and cheerful, with an excellent bathroom, and the reception staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. Breakfast was a good buffet selection. We did not use the attached restaurant, but the cafe section was useful for snacks and stayed open late. We were very well satisfied with the hotel generally.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Offandrunning
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 10-day trip to Spain. Spent two of those nights at the Hotel Opera. As others have mentioned, location was great - close to the metro, Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor, etc. We were in a triple (2 single beds with a separate sofa bed that was made up and ready to go when we arrived). Cost was $174/night for the 3 of us so per person charge was reasonable, although we were not offered the breakfast. Staff was helpful and made attempts to both speak English and understand my fractured Spanish. Linens were great, wonderful fluffy towels. We were serenaded both nights by late-prowling Spaniards so if this is NOT a cultural experience for you, request a room away from the street. Didn't realize there was a shuttle to/from the airport until we had arrived at the hotel. Cost (I think) was 12 euro/pp. Our cab in morning traffic was 60 euro so definitely worth booking this one!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Domo1509
Reviews.Content: Location of the Hotel was perfect, almost everything you needed was within walking distance (Pubs, Restaurants, Shopping District ,The Royal Palace, Sol, Plaza Mayor), & anything that was outside walking distance(Estadio Santiago Bernebeu, museums, etc), Metro Nearby, Taxi Rank Nearby, Bus Stop nearby. Plus the Hop-on/Hop-off bus stop for sightseeing the best way to see Madrid again nearby. As for the Hotel it covered all the basics for us Clean Room, Clean Bathroom, Comfortable beds (Everything well cleaned Daily), Safe, Minibar, Laundry service, T.V.(but CNN was the only english speaking channel)., but i wasn't there for to watch Television. As for reception i had very little dealing with them only to Check in & Check out. Only Two P.C's there with Internet access & they kept crashing in us(which was annoying), there's also WiFi (Can't Comment on it, wasn't equiped for it). Breakfast was simple & Basic (But Nice), same food every morning. But all in all i enjoyed my stay at this hotel & would recommend it Liked: Location Disliked: Computers kept crashing

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you value your privacy”
Reviews.Author: lolaborro
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room in this hotel for a friend that came to stay in Madrid and never again. During his stay my friend ask me to come up to his room to show me some photographs and when we were heading up to the room, one of the receptionists asked me where I was going. I explained I was with my friend who was a guest, and that we were going to his room, to what the receptionist replied that if I wasn't a guest, I couldn't go upstairs. I complained about this and in the end the receptionist 'allowed' me to go upstairs. About an hour later, guess what, we got a phone call from reception asking me to leave the room!!! The next evening, when my friend went back to the hotel after dinner, he found the door was shut!!! he banged and called for almost half an hour until someone finally came and opened up, and they claim to have a 24hr reception. Clearly, after this, my friend checked out and we found him another hotel, there's no way he was going to stay there any longer, and neither should you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: berylcook
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It right in the heart of the action next to the Opera house and metro. The area is within walking distance of the Plaza Mayor but still quiet enough not to disturb. It is very easy to get to hotel from airport using metro. This is a very good hotel for its price range. The staff were helpful. Free internet in the lobby. Rooms clean with all expected facilities. Breakfast was included but nothing special. But then to be honest I have seen very few good breakfasts in european hotels. The only thing that marred this was our first night there (a saturday) they had overbooked our room. Not a good start. At least they had booked us an alternative at a similar class a 10 minute walk down the street. Far better was when we returned to try again the next day they upgraded us to a room with a balcony and jucuzzi which was fantastic. In my mind at least more than amking up for the hassle as it wasa far better room then was within the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in middle Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Travellerisrael
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in the middle of Madrid. 1. location - Excellent, above Opera metro station in the middle of madrid, 5 minutes walk form Plaza puerta de sol, 1 minute from royal palace and surprisingly in a not so loud street given it's location. 2. rooms - we stayed in a regular room with nice views on to the street, there are better and more expensive rooms with terraces, but i guess it's better in summer and not autumn. the room is mostly taken up by the comfortable bed. there is WIFI which is working and two free internet stands down stairs. 3. staff - while not overly nice, are attentive, speak english and are quite helpful. 4. buffet breakfast - standard, better i think to skip it and eat in one of the many cafes around, overall a very nice hotel in the middle of madrid, it seems a bit expensive (139 E for doubel room for night in weekend at end of season) but maybe these are the prices. I would consider going back to this hotel in my next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyoto5301
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Opera has a very good price, in an excellent location. For this price, one cannot expect the very top of the line in hotels. However, the room was cute, the bathroom clean, and the AC worked well. The room was a bit worse for wear and tear, but otherwise fine. We didn't try the breakfast buffet but did eat in the Cafe Opera, which was disappointing at least, for breakfast. You are very close to the Palace Royal when staying at the Opera, and we had a lovely stroll in that area. There are also several nice cafes right in that area. You can easily walk to other touristic sites from this hotel; it is a slightly long but pleasant walk to the museums, for example. For value and location, this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Steve-McNaughton
Reviews.Content: I did like the location of this place. Shopping and tourist sites at hand and Metro station nearby. I had a single room which was just about big enough for me. Reception staff spoke good English but I have got to say that they could have been more helpful when I made enquiries. eg. had to meet a friend at his hotel and asked for directions but all they did was jot down the hotel phone number. Little things like that irritate me. Bed and bathroom were clean and comfortable enough without being anything special. Overall would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights at the opera”
Reviews.Author: willandallison
Reviews.Content: The elevator was on the fritz. We failed to get all but one note left at the desk by friends in Madrid and that note (a telephone message) was indecipherable. The sheets were rough hewn and staff, with one exception, was indifferent. We would not return. That said, the location was perfect for forays around town and the air conditioning functioned properly.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: weRtravelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in March, 2007. The rooms are dingy and seemed unclean. We were on a lower level and the street noise was unbearable. Hotel staff was not friendly or accomodating. The only good feature was the free internet. We would not stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Needs renovations”
Reviews.Author: amsdon
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at the Hotel Opera based on location & favorable comments from Maribel guides, Rick Steves & other reviews. The location was terrific; right next to the opera house, the Palace was 2 blocks away, and Sol & Plaza Mayor and Cava Brava a short 10 minute walk ..Many good restaurants and sights are nearby within walking distance. The Vision on/off bus around the corner. The Opera metro also nearby. The hotel offers a cold buffet breakfast and as well has a cafe which serves some tapas, sandwiches and a limited menu most of the day. In addition there is the Cafe de la Opera, which unfortunately we did not get to try but seemed nice. It seems they have a connecting room on the 7th floor which may be of interest to families. The cold buffet was good in a comfortable breakfast room. Pastry, breads, coldcuts, chorizo, plenty of jamon, fruit and juice, yogurt & cereal. Sometimes tortilla espanola...good. It was all included in our room price. I would not pay more than 8 E for it otherwise, as there are plenty of places nearby. We were dissapointed with the accomodations. They were very dingy. The roof leaked. The carpet seemed dirty or perhaps just very faded . While the housekeeping staff was great, there was a mustiness about the place. Our room 706 faced a side street (good) had great windows with storm coverings that made the room pitchblack if desired, was average size with good a closet & great bath. The water pressure was wonderful with plenty of hot water. We requested a higher floor (Hotel has about 8 floors) and got the 1st floor. They quickly and obligingly changed us to the 7th floor. Good start. At this hotel one handles their own luggage. No problem , elevator was good. The room was average size for Spain, about 10 x 10. Noise from the street was minimal if the windows were closed. The uneven quality of the staff we expected. Some were very pleasant and helpful, others intentionally rude. On the last night it began to rain quite heavily. Within minites we had a large pool of water dripping through the ceiling on the bed. A very nice and very apologetic female desk clerk offered us any room available. We moved quickly in view of the amount of water falling through the ceiling, without any help however, to a better room (except for the terrible smell that permeates the smokers' rooms... ) The last night was not good. Upon check out the staff suggested it would be better if I hailed my own cab since we were traveling a shorter distance than the airport. The taxis might not like that, they said. No mention was made of the fiasco with the leaking roof this time. It looked as if the Opera Hotel had once been a distinguished lady in a sea of trendier places. Sadly this hotel is in now dire need of repairs. And perhaps a staff meeting of some sort . It is certainly in a charming area. Rather than booking at the Opera I would instead consider the sister hotel, Meninas, or the Intur Palacio San Martin a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but too much noise”
Reviews.Author: gertieFl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location about 2 blocks from the Royal Palace and one block from one of the tour compaines where you can book day trips to Avila, etc. The triple room and the bathroom were spacious and very clean. The air conditioner was disconnected at the time we went, and being from FL we slept with the windows open. The noise outside from the street at night was terrible. Between the motor scooters, and the city pick up of recycled glass in the middle of the night, we did not get any restful sleep. They smash the bottles before they are disposed in the recycle bins. Even with the windows closed it was terrible. Ask for an inner room. All in all it was about the location. Staff was a bit cold.

Reviews.Title: “Good but no double bed”
Reviews.Author: azitun
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really good, it really well located, the staff were talking in english and it was clean. Our room was big, really clean, but there was 2 single bed instead of a double bed. When we asked for a double bed, they said that the room of the hotel only had single beds and no double bed. As we were in Spain to celebrate our wedding anniversary, this was a romance killer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blondiee77
Reviews.Content: The best thing about staying here is the location. Just a few feet from the Royal Palace and also conveniently located by a metro station. I stayed there in September and loved the fact that I could just walk across the street and there was the Royal Palace! The Opera House is also located there and there are great little outdoor cafe's you can sit at and people watch. The staff at the Opera (all spoke English) were all very nice and helpfull with directions, suggestions, etc... Our tour package included daily breakfast which was nice, though I wasn't crazy about the food... The rooms are small but clean, and they have a nice little basket of lotions, soaps, etc.. in the bathroom. We were located on the 2nd floor and didn't have any problems with noise, disturbances, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: di.1
Reviews.Content: Good location but thats it. Staff rude & unhelpfull & the rooms needed a good clean.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, nice people but...”
Reviews.Author: ordep
Reviews.Content: Its very well lacated near the Opera, the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor and churches or museums, but a little sad and gray. Rooms don't have roughs or carpets. Ask for an upper floor to avoid street noise. Staff were friendly and helpful but there was a sort of senior clerk teatching a stagiary that was incredible... You can take the breakfest at the Opera Cafeteria open to the public for a lower price (€ 3,5 with natural orange juice).

Reviews.Title: “clean & great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sfgpgirl
Reviews.Content: what more could you want? yeah, OK there's no bellman to help with baggage, and breakfast wasn't included in the price of the room, but it's still a good value for the central location. English is their 2nd language here, so do yourself a favor and learn a few verses of Spanish and get accquainted with their local customs (like siesta times) The front desk staff helped us choose a cool Flamenco joint, and booked a hotel in Pamplona for us too. Cafe staff was friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but dark”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is good hotel, with a reasonable price, generally confortable, but it gave me a sensation of darkness, maybe because of its location or its deco. The service is quite good, I have no complais on this subject, and everything was clean and tidy. The rooms were not very big, but had windows facing the Teatro Real, which made them nice, though they need to be repainted, at least. The beds are confortable. The location is excellent, within walking distance to the Gran Vía, Plaza España, the Royal Palace, Almudena Cathedral, Plaza de Oriente, in middle of everything. However, parking your car is a pain on the neck and some streets in the area look old and polluted. It is a good hotel but I think that for a similar price there are better places to stay in the same area, like the Vincci Capitol and the Best Western Casón del Tormes.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately priced and well located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews of the Madrid Opera I almost cancelled my reservation but am glad I didn't. This is a very reasonably priced hotel for its good location, within easy walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay etc. The rooms are small but adequate. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was good. With the cost of everything else in Paris, this is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights Jan 2005. Perfect location, we purchased tourist metro passes and ended up not really needing them. We were able to walk to almost all historical sites (Metro stop Opera only a block away). Room was clean, could use an update otherwise typically spanish. We traveled with our 18 month old so we pushed the 2 single beds together. Room was larger than typical european room. Overall good experience for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dwl4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Nov.30, 2004. The hotel is very centrally located, close to the subway as well as the center part of town. The price is also reasonable - 90 euro including breakfast for two. However, the staff was not overly friendly and the room we had was small. It was on the first floor facing the square, so it was kind of noisy. Be sure to ask for a room on a higher floor not facing the front if you decide to choose this hotel for its location.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ClaraM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Opera at the beginning of November for three nights and found the hotel to be ideally situated. It was within easy walking distance of all the sites. The staff were extremely pleasant, the rooms comfortable and clean and the buffet breakfast very adequate. We were also pleased that it was away from too much traffic noise. Not to be missed is the dinner at night - not because the food was anything exceptional but the opera singing waiters and waitresses were superb! A great experience. We would certainly use this hotel if visiting Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Popebaron
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just across the road from the Opera and the Madrid Vision tour bus stop. Metro just around the corner and the Royal palace 2 minutes stroll away. Other key sites like Plaza Mayor, Espana and Sol can be visited on foot Our room was clean and comfortble and met all our requirements. Maybe a bit small by US standards. We were not distrubed by street noise providing the window shutters were completely down. Thought breakfast was expensive at 10 euros each however the hotel has a coffee shop next door which we used. Would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd asked my travel agent for a clean, inexpensive hotel, in a safe nieghborhood. The Opera was perfect for us. My two girlfriends and I spent five nights there in June. Right across the street from the Opera House. Staff was friendly, informative and very helpful with VERY heavy luggage. We were about four long city blocks from Puerta del Sol and shopping district. We were also about a block away from the Palace. If you're a light sleeper, ask for an inside facing room. It gets quite noisy at night but for me, it only added to the charm of being in Madrid. Who sleeps in Madrid?? Also, FREE internet access. Across the street was a Burger King and McDonalds. For local flavor The Cafe La Traviata was delightful. (Also across the street.) We attended a great Flamenco show at Torres Bermejas restaurante. 29.00 Euro for the show and one drink.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: gringaviajera
Reviews.Content: I must say this hotel is a LOSER!!!! For the same money you can stay at the Tryp Reina Victoria and have everything first class with breakfast!!! This hotel was in a sleazy neiborhood, hidden on a dark ugly street...the room was tiny and extremely sparse....no breakfast included and absoluletly nobody to help with your bags or who cared if you needed help. The staff was far from friendly and I ended up changing hotels after the first night and they won`t even get you a taxi.....the only reason I give them a rating of two is because about a block away we found a fantastic restaurant that we would never have found otherwise and that made it a lot better!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Catf
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in Hotel Opera. Really impressed with the great position of the hotel (walking distance from all the main places), yet it was in a quiet street, virtually opposite the Metro. Had a large clean room, with marble bathroom and all staff were polite and helpful. Outside your door are plently of places to eat and drink too, and the shops are only just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Around the Corner from the Action, and the Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: kitjones
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect - right in the action, but not too noisy. The room itself was fairly average, although the bathroom was quite nice (and we had the largest room - a triple). We didn't find the staff that friendly. We asked for a third pillow (since we had a triple room, it seemed reasonable that we get a third pillow!), and an extra blanket or two, and were told that they would try to get them for us, but they might not be able to. All in all, the hotel was fine, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Opera Hotel, a very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: monas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this lovely hotel. The staff was very nice, our room was charming, and the hotel location was excellent! We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly on the outside, nice on the inside”
Reviews.Author: Reisende_Rolf
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be located in the ugliest building in central Madrid, but otherwise it is a nice and cheap hotel on a central location near the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor and the Metro system. The rooms are well equiped, the staff is freindly and the breakfast is tasty. At a price well below 100 € / night, this is a very good offer!

Reviews.Title: “A must”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel. I went to MAdrid for business and I booked this hotel. I connected my notepad internet free in all the hotel. Staff is very kind and also I went to the musical-dinner FANTASTIC
